title: Client Crashing before Loading Screen
body:
The Title basically says it. Game works perfectly fine until the end of champ select and when it moves onto loading screen, it crashes.
(I tried reconnecting but it will still crash after reconnecting)
Has anyone else had problems like this or is it just my computer screwing up?

replies.body:
Hey Mystriven,

I suggest performing a [client repair, or forcing a repatch](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues) if that doesn't work. Are you on a Mac? I've seen several having Mac issues and I don't know if there's a fix for that yet. Let me know if anything helps.

-DTN

Hey Deep Terror Nami,

Thanks for your tip! Unfortunately, after trying client repair it still seemed to crash so it must be my computer's fault.
I'll try reinstalling the game itself and see if anything changes for the better...

Mystriven
Are you getting an error message with the crash?
I get the generic windows one (Legague of Legends (TM) Client has stopped working) and it forces me to end the client

Had you already reinstalled and still gotten the error before you made this reply?

* If not, let me know if it helped.
* If yes, are you running any League applications such as Lolreplay, or have any third party mods installed? If so, try disabling or removing them before you patch.
I am having the same problem, and have tried all of the things mentioned above as well. This is very frustrating.
If you happen to be using Lolreplays, uninstall that. There's an issue with it atm.
OMG Thank you for your comment...I spent hours tried to make league of legends.exe working, and it turned out to have conflict with lolreplays.

Deep Terror Nami,

I removed Lolreplay and reinstalled it as you said and now it works perfectly fine!
Thank you for your help, without it I would have been lost forever :)

I'm having the same issue on PC. It was fine yesterday and then when I went to play a game today that same error occurred. I tried a client repair but that didn't work at all. I'm seeing some similar reports on the NA forums though so it might be a common thing.
